content: What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others.
author: Confucius

content: If you have the guts to keep making mistakes, your wisdom and intelligence leap forward with huge momentum.
author: Holly Near

content: It is easier to live through someone else than to become complete yourself.
author: Betty Friedan

content: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
author: Sun Tzu

content: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
author: Confucius

content: To effectively communicate, we must realize that we are all different in the way we perceive the world and use this understanding as a guide to our communication with others.
author: Tony Robbins

content: That old law about 'an eye for an eye' leaves everybody blind. The time is always right to do the right thing.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

content: The sum of wisdom is that time is never lost that is devoted to work.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

content: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

content: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

content: The greater part of human pain is unnecessary. It is self-created as long as the unobserved mind runs your life.
author: Eckhart Tolle

content: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
author: Laozi

content: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

content: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
author: Jim Rohn

content: It is on our failures that we base a new and different and better success.
author: Havelock Ellis

content: All human wisdom is summed up in two words; wait and hope.
author: Alexandre Dumas

content: When a friend is in trouble, don't annoy him by asking if there is anything you can do. Think up something appropriate and do it.
author: A. Powell Davies

content: Be Impeccable with Your Word. Speak with integrity. Say only what you mean. Avoid using the word to speak against yourself or to gossip about others. Use the power of your word in the direction of truth and love.
author: Don Miguel Ruiz

content: As an elephant in the battlefield withstands arrows shot from bows all around, even so shall I endure abuse.
author: The Buddha

content: If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough.
author: Albert Einstein

content: Always seek out the seed of triumph in every adversity.
author: Og Mandino

content: The bird of paradise alights only upon the hand that does not grasp.
author: John Berry

content: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.
author: The Buddha

content: Tell me and I forget. Teach me and I remember. Involve me and I learn.
author: Benjamin Franklin

content: Knowing is not enough; we must apply!
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

content: If you'll not settle for anything less than your best, you will be amazed at what you can accomplish in your lives.
author: Vince Lombardi

content: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
author: Lord Byron

content: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

content: The smallest deed is better than the greatest intention.
author: John Burroughs

content: Maxim for life: You get treated in life the way you teach people to treat you.
author: Wayne Dyer

content: I, too, do not envision a doctrine of self the clinging to which there would not arise sorrow, lamentation, pain, grief, and despair.
author: The Buddha

content: Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can.
author: Richard Bach

content: We don't know a millionth of one percent about anything.
author: Thomas Edison

content: The best thing in every noble dream is the dreamer...
author: Moncure D. Conway

content: Motivation is the art of getting people to do what you want them to do because they want to do it.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

content: All phenomena are preceded by the mind, created by the mind, and have the mind as their master.
author: The Buddha

content: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to a better understanding of ourselves.
author: Carl Jung

content: The foolish man seeks happiness in the distance, the wise grows it under his feet.
author: James Oppenheim

content: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

content: The lure of the distant and the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are.
author: John Burroughs

content: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
author: Laozi

content: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
author: Albert Einstein

content: By living deeply in the present moment we can understand the past better and we can prepare for a better future.
author: Thích Nhất Hạnh

content: If one is estranged from oneself, then one is estranged from others too. If one is out of touch with oneself, then one cannot touch others.
author: Anne Lindbergh

content: The best thing about the future is that it only comes one day at a time.
author: Abraham Lincoln

content: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
author: Carl Jung

content: Wisdom ceases to be wisdom when it becomes too proud to weep, too grave to laugh, and too selfish to seek other than itself.
author: Kahlil Gibran

content: You cannot step twice into the same river, for other waters are continually flowing in.
author: Heraclitus

content: Inspiration exists, but it has to find us working.
author: Pablo Picasso

content: The most formidable weapon against errors of every kind is reason.
author: Thomas Paine
